answers.q: how much is propane per gallon
answers.a: Propane prices vary by region, season, and whether it’s bulk delivery or a cylinder refill. In the U.S., recent retail refill prices often run about $2–$4 per gallon, while tank exchanges tend to cost more per gallon; check local suppliers.
No—propane itself doesn’t expire; in a sealed cylinder it remains stable indefinitely, though the cylinder/valve condition and the odorant can degrade over time.

answers.q: how much does a gallon of propane weigh
answers.a: About 4.2 lb per gallon as a liquid at 60°F (weight varies slightly with temperature).

answers.q: how much is a propane tank
answers.a: A new empty 20‑lb grill cylinder typically costs about $40–$70. Large stationary tanks (250–1,000 gal) are several hundred to several thousand dollars or are often leased; prices vary by region.
At propane refill stations such as propane dealers, many hardware stores, some gas stations, farm/garden centers, and RV parks; for 20‑lb cylinders you can also use exchange cages.
